ul.li: MP3 files support
Standard player functions: repeat, shuffle, intro, fast forward/rewind, mute, volume, position in track...
Advanced player functions :
Push : Add track(s) in the player queue
Recursive play/repeat/shuffle/push in directories/sub-directories or by style/author/albums...
Intro from a track % and with a specified length
Bestof magic function : play your favorite tracks
Full shuffle in entire collection
Search functions:
Web navigator-like history bar
Instant search box : perform instant search on style/author/track name... when typing
Table filter : you can filter tracks with any criteria
Playlist support:
Dynamic playlist creation by drag and drop
Top n tracks playlist
Bookmarks playlist
Devices synchronization : unidirectional or bidirectional
Collection stats : get charts describing your collection : style repartition, size by device, history etc...
Physical / logical separation : you can navigate into physical directories and files or into logical styles, authors, albums, tracks

Indexing method : Jajuk doesn't read id3 tags or directory structure at each startup but save them in a XML database. It allows a fast startup even for very large collections (bench:10 sec to start a 140Go collection on a P4 1.8Ghz)

Unmounted devices support : you can navigate into unmounted devices ( CDs for exemple ). So you get a full view of your collection at any time. Nice feature if you have plenty of music CDs. This behavior can be disabled
Several Look and feel supported : Liquid, Metal, Windows, GTK, Kunststoff
Multilanguage ( English and French langpacks provided in 0.1)
Fast collection builder : a cd scanner allows you to create a jajuk collection of tens of CDs in only few minutes
Eclipse-like graphical interface : Jajuk windows are divided into perspectives and views for a good functionnal separation. Views can be hidden or resized
Full-featured online help (not yet written)
Covers support
Automatic rate support
Startup track: none, last one, specified, shuffle
Ogg Vorbis support
Java Web Start support
Playlist editor
Meta-properties support : you will be able to create a property of your own ( a rate or localisation system for exemple ) that you can set on tracks or any item
Peer to Peer device-type support
New online help contents
